"Prisoner’s Island, matchmaking negative players together, is a tempting, obvious solution to combating poor player behavior, but it’s ultimately just lazy design that only encourages further negativity. As players are exposed to more negative behavior, they just become more likely to quit playing any particular game--up to 320% more likely, in fact. That old saying about everything looking like a nail when all you have is a hammer applies here; low priority queues can work well in one very specific situation, but that doesn’t mean you can extend it to every player behavior problem. " -Lyte

But, what if there aren't enough toxic players for a given queue.

"Okay, we have four toxic players, and Jimmy, rough luck Jimmy, may the odds be ever in your favor"

The idea is:

1. You can't evade it by switching to a smurf like you can with a time ban.

2. You can't grind it out with 20-minute bot games where you don't have to change your behavior, or use a client-side bot to run around for you while your teammates win the game.

3. The tiny fraction of Ranked players who are restricted at any given time is spread across *all* the Normal Draft games.

4. You have to **win** Normal Draft matches without getting reported too much to get back into Ranked.  And they're chat-restricted while doing it.

"Prisoner's Island" causes its own problems.  It's certainly not a cure-all, and depending on implementation it can make things worse over time.  DOTA2 goes with this approach and there are still tons of complaints about player behavior in that game.

There should have like a "banned" queue. Where only banned players play. That would be fun to spectate.

You have to bear in mind that RIOT really doesn't want to lose customers. Some of these suggestions will force people right out the door.

You can say what you want, but if someone has a really bad day and is usually good, and then you force them into 30 bot games or prisoners island, they're likely to lose a solid amount of customers.

It just doesn't make business sense. And then if you lose a bunch of players, who are you going to play with? Some of the verbally toxic players that get mad are actually really solid players.

If they continue to be toxic in normals they will get a regular ban. The reason for having the midway point is that some people will care more about being forced to play normals more than just not being able to play at all (and go on a smurf or something). Having a variety of punishments means more people will get a punishment that makes them rethink their toxic ways.
